enWisdom: Apologizing necessitates pardoning
Forgiveness is the evidence of intelligence
Seeking pardon (or taking lesson) is a sincere warner

Wisdom: الِاسْتِغْنَاءُ عَنِ الْعُذْرِ أَعَزُّ مِنَ الصِّدْقِ
enWisdom: Being needless of offering an excuse is more honourable than truthfulness [in your excuse]
The person most deserving of having his request granted is one who seeks forgiveness
The interceder of a criminal is his humility in seeking pardon
One who apologizes has sought pardon
How good an intercessor seeking pardon is!
There is no intercessor more successful than apology

Wisdom: اقْبَلْ أَعْذَارَ النَّاسِ تَسْتَمْتِعْ بِإِخَائِهِمْ وَالْقَهُمْ بِالْبِشْرِ تُمِتْ أَضْغَانَهُمْ
enWisdom: Accept the excuses of people and you will enjoy their brotherhood; meet them with cheerfulness and you will cause their malice [and grudges against you] to die away

Wisdom: قَبُولُ عُذْرِ الْمُجْرِمِ مِنْ مَوَاجِبِ الْكَرَمِ وَمَحَاسِنِ الشِّيَمِ
enWisdom: Accepting the excuse of a wrongdoer is from the acts that bring honour and the [is] the most excellent of traits

Wisdom: كُنْ بَطِي‏ءَ الْغَضَبِ سَرِيعَ الْفَيْ‏ءِ مُحِبّاً لِقَبُولِ الْعُذْرِ
enWisdom: Be slow in getting angry, quick in calming down and ready to accept excuses
The worst misdeed is refusing to accept an excuse [that is valid]

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ مَنْ لَا يَقْبَلُ الْعُذْرَ وَلَا يُقِيلُ الذَّنْبَ
enWisdom: The worst person is one who neither accepts excuses nor pardons offences
Repeating the apology is a reminder of the sin
Repeating the apology is a reminder of the [past] sins
Too much apology magnifies the sins

Wisdom: مَنِ اعْتَذَرَ مِنْ غَيْرِ ذَنْبٍ فَقَدْ أَوْجَبَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ الذَّنْبَ
enWisdom: One who seeks pardon without having sinned has imposed the sin upon his soul

Wisdom: لَا تَعْتَذِرْ إِلَى مَنْ يُحِبُّ أَنْ لَا يَجِدَ لَكَ عُذْراً
enWisdom: Do not offer an excuse to the one who would like to find you without an excuse

Wisdom: يُسْتَثْمَرُ الْعَفْوُ بِالْإِقْرَارِ أَكْثَرُ مِمَّا يُسْتَثْمَرُ بِالاعْتِذَارِ
enWisdom: Pardon bears more fruit with admission [of one’s guilt] than it does with giving excuses
